projects.title: Withgoods
projects.description: Whenever I add or build a feature to Withgoods I always prioritised scalability and maintainability.

sections.title: Image generator
sections.description: Give a “classic” introduction to Withgoods and my mission there. Lambda and parallel running (infinite scale, no overcharge). Explain that first it ran in node and was slow and killed the server. Cylinder items felt flat so I added curve and light. Use a bezier curve to generate the exact curve wanted by the admins. Add the light effect for 3D and realism

sections.title: AI powered search engine
sections.description: We needed a scalable and reliable solution to index and search our good items. Using Google Vision API we can analyse the artwork our users upload and assign them tags and colors. For tags, we get only the ones with a high (>60% of certainty) score. Because our users are Korean speaking, the tags are then translated into Korean using Google Traduction API. Each tags are then inserted into our DB and the most common appear first in the autocomplete when searching. For color we use parse from Google Vision API the most common color in terms of presence (number of pixels), and of focus (center of image, higher focus etc). These colors are then matched with a custom palette of ours. This palette is then used for filtering. So now in addition to filtering per category of item, we can also filter per color. We can then search for these tags in the search bar in addition to strings such as artist or artwork name. We can search either for items or artwork.

sections.title: Automatic thumbnail generator
sections.description: Because it’s an e-commerce website with user generated images, the load of images to load was huge. We needed a scalable, flexible solution to reduce load time and charge. Using AWS Lambda edge capacity I made a on-demand thumbnail generator taking full advantage of edge cache to serve fast and light images.

projects.title: Sleek
projects.tech: JavaScript (ES6), Node.js, React, Vue, TDD, Mongoose
projects.description:
Sleek is a startup which offers online company secretary services. They provide a two-sided web platform. One side for the clients, one side for the corporate secretary admins.

My main contribution to the platform was maintaining and improving the API, refactoring the access control system, and building an automated reminding and renewing (billing) system. As the deadline for Sleek new service (e-signature) was approaching I switched to this project to speed up the development. My final task was the complete rework of the UI. We switched to a whole new stack (React to Vue). We built a lighter, faster and more maintainable UI.

projects.title: Maevents
projects.description:
Maevents is a rising tour operator. I worked with them to speed up their operation with a custom software.

I was in charge of the whole development process. I built a website to easily manage your client base and generate various contracts and reports. Data is hierarchically structured and presented in a clear way. A fuzzy-search bar allow you to quickly find what you’re looking for. There is also a data table where you get a big picture of your client base and perform global search.

projects.title: Hub-Grade
projects.description:
Office rental in France is very constraining. Hub-Grade is a start-up that offers flexible renting solutions.

They recruited me and two other interns to rework their website using modern technologies. I built a reliable API while my colleagues developed the front-end. Together we had a really fun and engaging teamwork experience.

projects.title: Game Jams
projects.description:
I took part in two Game Jam as a programmer working with game designers and artists. In both projects I did AI and game programming.

The first game "Lost my Mom" tells the story of a boy who lost his mom. You see the world through the eyes of a terrified child. You have to wander through a dark city to find her.

The second game "Elements Ritual" is a FPS. There are two enemies AI, one shoot from distance when they see you. The other one is melee fighter than roll up and explode before they die. You basically have to shoot your way through the levels and beat the boss to win the game.

projects.title: Naview
projects.description:
Naview is an immersive VR experience. It transports you in a 3D environment where you can watch videos with your friends. From within the app anyone can browse YouTube and add videos to a shared playlist. These videos will then synchronously play on the room's screen.

This project lasted over two years including ideation, documentation, coding and external promotion. We were six developers, spread all over the world during half this duration. I developed the playlist and the web browser both client and server side.
